sections.title: What are Variables?
sections.content: Variables in Java are containers that store data values. Think of them as labeled boxes where you can keep different types of information that your program can use and modify.

sections.title: Key Concepts:
items: Declaration: Creating a variable with a specific type
Initialization: Giving the variable its first value
Scope: Where in your code the variable can be used

sections.content: Create variables for a robot's properties:

An integer for the number of wheels
A double for the robot's weight in pounds
